description.p: WIZARDS LEARN FROM KNOWLEDGE. SORCERERS have their birthright. Warlocks trade dignity for a pact, andClerics devote themselves to another being. But us? We of the coven do not adhere to such traditions and instead we develop our connection with our ancestors, a bond with the natural cycle of life and death that only we truly can master.

Clutching her staff in her silver hands, she steps back to feel the earth at her feet crumble by the cliffside. Her face serene, she knows her fate as the ogres make their last lunge towards her. She calls upon the afterlife, conjuring anapparition to aid her in her final stand.

The goliath looks at his tribekin, placing a hand on each of their shoulders, divining their destiny. His clan is strong, but the spirits never lie, and he knows the upcoming ritual will help to alleviate the burdens his tribe will face in the winter. He gazes in the distance, a figure nods, and he stares back down at the closest of his kin. This was the one.

Drawing his sword, the human dashes between his foes, slashing their clothes, striking their chests, blood pouring onto the pavement. With a flick of his wrist, his armour glowsspectral blue, and his onslaught can continue into the night.

Whether calling on the spirits to guide them or summoning souls back from oblivion, weavers are the embodiment of the cycle of life and death. They offer little in the way of combat prowess, instead choosing to support those that do bychanneling the power of the afterlife and conjuring beings to assist them. Weavers see themselves as an extension of the natural life and death cycle. Some may see this as a privilege, where as others gain this power only to show their masteryover the worlds most absolute power. No matter the situation, a weavers control over the spiritual world and their ability to manifest that in their lives is revered.

The spiritual world is a part of the weave that all beings that have since past on must go through. It’s a culmination of the realms of the multiverse, having no tangible presence in any world and instead persists as energy that fuels, guides and watches over the world. Spirits exist within this world as entities of departed creatures. Restless spirits often enter thematerial plane or never depart if their role in the world is not complete, and these are the spirits most adventurers would encounter. Revenants, spectres and ghosts are just some of many examples of a being like this. However, a weaver is able to attune themselves to detect the spirits inside their own world, and with enough practice, draw them out into the physical world to assist them in their roles. Spirits drawn out in this method often not only retain their own memories inlife, but their skills to use it. Weavers that manifest these beings typically do so with a purpose, and a restless spirit will opt to return to their spiritual world as quickly as possible.

The afterlife is a solid, representable force for a weaver. It is intrinsic to their nature, and effects their way of lifedramatically. Having a spiritual connection with the occult and the absolute cycle changes the very essence of a weaver, and influences their actions, decisions and choices in life. A constant between all weavers is their respect and admirationfor the cycle of life. Living is a gift, and their spirit guide often helps to direct their abilities and growth to better respect their own role within the life and death cycle.

Rebirth for most weavers is just another part of the cycle. Resurrection magic already exists and is used frequently, even with its high price, so how is manipulating spirits any different? To them, their manipulation of a creatures soul to manifest them in the world is nothing more than an extension of this belief, and the natural cycle. Some weavers may take pleasure in bringing creatures back, others will not. Some believe its necessary, others think the dead should be laid to rest unless absolutely necessary. Some would manifest the spirits physically, others would instead just callto them for guidance. Regardless of the weaver, their attitudes to life, death, and eventual rebirth at their hands is rarely consistent with another of their kind.

When creating your weaver, you must first consider your relationship with the spiritual world. How and why did you connect with the spirits? Answering this question will help tocement the powers your weaver has and their world view. Consider the connection they have, and how exactly they use it.

Once you’ve decided the nature of their spirital connection and beliefs, you can start to consider the deeper aspects ofthis relationship. Are they using the connection to get closer to their ancestors? Are they on a quest to save the soul of a loved one? Are they purely using their powers to conquer heights the world has never seen? Why do the spirits helpyou? How has your upbringing effected this connection? How would you be perceived by priests, mages, or other spellcasters? What are your ultimate goals? Do these goals have any relation to your spiritual connection? What drivesyou to continue as a weaver?
You can make a weaver quickly by following thesesuggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution or Wisdom. Second, choose the haunted one background.
As a weaver, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per weaver level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Animal Handling, Arcana, Deception, History, Insight, Medicine, Nature, and Religion.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a quarterstaff or (b) any simple ranged weapon
(a) two daggers or (b) any simple melee weapon
Leather armor, a priest’s pack, and a spiritual focus

description.p: If your group uses the optional rule on multiclassing in the Player’s Handbook, you must have an Intelligence score of at least 13 to take a level in this class. You gain no additional proficiencies when you multiclass into a weaver.

div.p: As a weaver, you have a new casting device: the spiritual focus. A spiritual focus is in ways similar to an arcane focus, acting as a magical source for spellcasting. In order to use spell slots in the Weaver class, you must have one of these on your person. You can create a spiritual focus by spending 1 hour retuning an arcane focus.

setters.set: A spellcaster that mixes the power of spirits with magic.
You gain no additional proficiencies when you multiclass into a weaver.

description.p: Through your tests, study, and devotion to learning the spiritual world, you have come across a number of spirits which you can bring into the material plane briefly. These spirits imbue you, or a creature you target with a magical boon or hex that lasts for a short duration.

You learn a number of total manifestations equal to half your weaver level + your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1 known). You can only choose from the list of Lesser Manifestations. Your manifestation options are detailed at the end of the class description. You can create lesser manifestations by expending a charge from your Manifestation Pool, the size of which is shown in the Weaver class table. The maximum amount of manifestations you can have active at any given time is equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1). You regain all expended uses of thisfeature when you finish a long rest.

Unless otherwise stated, all manifestations last for 1 minute, have a casting time of 1 action, require verbal and somatic components, target a single creature, and have a range of 60 feet. A manifestation cannot stack with itself.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the manifestations you know and replace it with another manifestation that you can learn.

Lesser, greater and exotic manifestations are treated as 1st, 3rd, and 5th level magic respectively for the purposes ofdispelling them. A creature under the effects of a manifestation can attempt to dispel the manifestation as an action or bonus action on their turn. They must succeed an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC, endingthe effect of a single manifestation on a success. A remove curse spell or similar magic removes all manifestations.

sheet.description: You known {{manifestations:known}} manifestations. You have a pool of manifestation charges. You can expend 1 charge to create a lesser manifestation. You can have up to {{manifestations:active}} manifestations active at a time.

You known {{manifestations:known}} manifestations. You have a pool of manifestation charges. You can expend 1 charge to create a lesser manifestation, and 4 charges to create a greater manifestation. You can have up to {{manifestations:active}} manifestations active at a time.

You can expend 1 charge to create a lesser manifestation, 4 charges to create a greater manifestation, and 10 charges (7 if from your Spirit Guide) to create an exotic manifestation. You can have up to {{manifestations:active}} manifestations active at a time.

description.p: Your connection with the spiritual world is undeniable. You can perceive creatures on the Ethereal Plane as a ghostly but clear image. You can interact with creatures on this plane only if a creature is willing.

In addition, you can see and sense any restless spirits near you. When a body of a creature that has died and their soul is yet to depart to the afterlife is within 60-feet of you, you can communicate with them. Your DM determines if a creature’s soul has passed on. This could be immediate, or it could be a millenia since the creature died, but a creature will pass on immediately unless it has unfinished business or wishes to communicate with the party. You see their form as that of when they looked when they died, and you cannot physicallyinteract with them, but you can communicate with them if they understand at least one language.

div.p: The spiritual connection feature is intended as a way for a weaver to roleplay the communication aspect of their class. Dungeon Master’s should try and involve this feature in a quest’s design. Key information can be acquired that previously would’ve been unavailable to the player characters. Treat this feature in a similar way to the speak with dead spell.

sheet.description: You can perceive creatures on the Ethereal Plane as a ghostly but clear image. When a body of a creature that has died and their soul is yet to depart to the afterlife is within 60-feet of you, you can communicate with them. Your DM determines if a creature’s soul has passed on.

description.p: By 2nd level, you have learned to channel magical energy through your experience and study with the weave. See chapter 10 of the Player’s Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 5 of the Book of Radiance for the weaver spell list.

The weaver table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your weaver spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended slots when you finish a long rest. For example, if you know the 1st-level spell bless and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you cancast bless using either slot.
description.h5: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
description.p: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the weaverspell list. The Spells Known column of the Weaver table shows when you learn more weaver spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in thisclass, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the weaver spells you know and replace it with another spell from the weaver spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your weaver spells. The power of your spells comes from your experimentation and conceptual understanding of the spiritual world. You use your Intelligence whenever a weaver spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligencemodifier when setting the saving throw DC for a weaver spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

description.p: You can cast any weaver spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.
You must use a spiritual focus as a spellcasting focus for yourweaver spells. You can take an hour to turn an arcane focus into a spiritual focus.

div.p: Intelligence is the spellcasting ability for two main reasons. A weaver gains their power through experience, yes, but it is ultimately their understanding of the concepts behind the spirit world that enables them to draw out the spirits. And of course, the fact that there is no Intelligence half caster certainly played a part.

description.p: When you reach 3rd level, your supernatural abilities allow you to connect to a spiritual guide. Up to this time, your spiritguide had yet to reveal themselves to you, instead choosing to direct you from a distance. Now you choose the one of the following guides: Archmage, all detailed at the end of the class description.
Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at6th, 10th, and 18th level. Those features include spirit spells and unique Manifestations.

A spirit guide is a spiritual being that a weaver learns from. Their unending knowledge and wisdom helps to guide them in their actions and their situations. Unlike Clerics, Warlocks and other adventurers who often have little contact with the source of their power, a weaver’s spirit guide exists solely for them, and is often communicating with them during their downtime. Weavers take great pride in their spirit guides, and they strive to represent their teacher the best way they can.

div.h5: Spirit Guide’s Role with the Weaver
div.p: Spirit Guide’s fill a similar role to that of a Patron to their Warlocks. While they don’t grant their powers to their weavers directly, they instead help to educate them on using their supernatural powers. A spirit guide can be as active or as passive as the DM wants, but it can prove to be a useful tool to inspire roleplaying and help to solidify their character within the world. It’s highly recommended to have a spirit guide play a more active role, helping to assist the weaver in their training, particularly through down time activities.

As a weaver, you should carefully consider the relationship you have with your spirit guide. Does your spirit guide hope to bolster your skills for their personal gain, or another reason? Do you know who your spirit guide was in life?

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you can shift one of your spirits to a new target. As a reaction to a creature with a manifestation targeting them dying, you can shift the manifestation to target another creature within 60-feet of the first target. The duration remains the same.

In addition, you can drain your arcane energy to help connect with the spirit world better. You can expend one spell slot to regain a number of expended manifestation pool charges equal to twice the spell slot level.

div.p: As you will see with the spell list, the casting of the weaver is limited. The intention was to have the weaver expend spell slots to use with their manifestation feature rather than cast spells. This design allows the weaver to be far less careful with their manifestations and helps to cement the supportive playstyle by having the weaver be more open to using their skills to help limit the party’s weaknesses.

sheet.description: As a reaction to a creature with a manifestation targeting them dying, you can shift the manifestation to target another creature within 60-feet of the first target. The duration remains the same. You can expend one spell slot to regain a number of expended manifestation pool charges equal to twice the spell slot level.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choiceby 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

When you reach 5th level, you can call upon greater manifestations. When you gain a level in this class, you cannow choose from the list of Greater Manifestations as well as Lesser Manifestations. You can conjure a greater manifestation by expending 4 charges from your Manifestation Pool. Your choices must obey the restrictions of the Manifestations feature.

Beginning at 7th level, you can focus on a manifestation to force it to remain for longer. When you conjure a manifestation on a target, you can choose to concentrate on it like you would a spell and extend its duration to 10 minutes. If you lose concentration, the manifestation ends.
At 15th level, the duration you can concentrate on a spirit is extended to 1 hour.

div.p: The Extended Servitude feature is intended to make the Weaver’s utility a little stronger outside of combat. Certain manifestations, namely the Artisan, Cook, Musician, and similar spirits are exceedingly weak due to be unable to be proficient for the long lengths of time that is required to benefit use these things. Extended Servitude helps to allow these out of combat spirits to be stronger.

But how does this scale with other manifestations that are used in combat such as Defender or Magician? In general, the fact a spirit can be ended early when it is created this way by failing a concentration check limits its viability in combat. Remember, although you are making concentration checks on Manifestations, you do not gain any benefits from the War Caster feat for the manifestation.

sheet.description: When you conjure a manifestation on a target, you can choose to concentrate on it like you would a spell and extend its duration to 10 minutes. If you lose concentration, the manifestation ends.
When you conjure a manifestation on a target, you can choose to concentrate on it like you would a spell and extend its duration to 1 hour. If you lose concentration, the manifestation ends.

description.p: When you reach 11th level, you regain a number of expended uses of your manifestation feature equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1) when you finish a Short rest.

sheet.description: When you finish a short rest, you regain {{manifestations:active}} expended manifestation charges.

description.p: When you reach 14th level, you can call upon exotic manifestations. When you gain a level in this class, you cannow choose from the list of Exotic Manifestations as well as Greater and Lesser Manifestations. You can conjure an exotic manifestation by expending 10 charges from your Manifestation Pool. If you conjure an exotic manifestationfrom your Spirit Guide manifestation table, this amount is instead reduced to 7. Your choices must obey the restrictions of the Manifestations feature.

You have reached the pinnacle of a weaver when you reach 20th level. Choose two lesser manifestations you know. You can conjure both of these manifestations without expending a charge from your Manifestation Pool.

sheet.description: You can conjure your Eidolon manifestations without expending a charge from your Manifestation Pool.

description.p: Archmage’s are the pinnacle of mortal magical power, commanding extreme and often unparalleled mastery over the craft. The spirit of one of the great Archmage’s lives onthrough you, and you seek to learn from their experience and unmatched study. The nature of your Archmage guide may be a specific wizard, one who lived and breathed in a time before you. Maybe your guide is nothing more than an embodimentof your will to better understand the arcane force within the universe.
Regardless of who they are, the Archmage spirit guide will teach and guide you down the coveted arcane path, and train you into a masterful spellcaster that few will match.

Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to call upon an additionalmanifestation when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Expanded Manifestations table. The manifestation doesn’t count against the number of weaver manifestations you know.

When you reach 3rd level, you learn an additional spell whenyou reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Archmage Spells table. The spell counts as a weaver spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of weaver spells you know.
At 3rd level, you learn two cantrips of your choice from the Wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for both.

At 6th level, you have learned how to manipulate the arcane with your spiritual magic. You can roll an additional d4 and add it to any spell attack roll made against a creature under the effects of one of your manifestations.

sheet.description: You can roll an additional d4 and add it to any spell attack roll made against a creature under the effects of one of your manifestations.

description.p: By 10th level, you have experimented with magic alongside your spiritual powers. If you cast a spell with a casting time of one action, you can conjure a spirit with a manifestation time of 1 action as a bonus action by expending an additional charge from your Manifestation Pool.

sheet.description: If you cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, you can conjure a spirit with a manifestation time of 1 action as a bonus action by expending an additionalcharge from your Manifestation Pool.

description.p: When you reach 18th level, your spirit guide has blessed you with the strongest of magical knowledge. As a bonus action, you can expend one spell slot and target one spellcaster within 60 feet. The target regains any number of expended spell slots up to a combined level that is equal to the level of the spell slot expended.

sheet.description: You can expend one spell slot and target one spellcaster within 60 feet. The target regains any number of expended spell slots up to a combined level that is equal to the level of the spell slot expended.

description.p: The King is a powerful spirit guide. Ruled by their desire to become stronger, a weaver who takes the time to master the teachings of the King will command a dominating presence and voice on the battlefield. Weavers of this discipline areextremely devout warriors, combining their supernatural abilities with their martial prowess for a deadly combination. Your king may be a forgotten one, lost to time after a millenia of fallen kingdoms. Maybe your guide is a renowned leader, known to legend as a powerful entity.
In any case, the King spirit guide will train you in martial skills and battlefield tactics, taking you down the path of domination.

Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to call upon an additionalmanifestation when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Expanded Manifestations table. The manifestation doesn’t count against the number of weaver manifestations you know.
When you choose this spirit guide at 3rd level, you gainproficiency in martial weapons, medium armour, and shields.

Beginning at 3rd level, you learn to weave your manifestations on the frontlines. You can perform the somatic components of manifestations even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands. In addition, when you use your manifestation feature on your turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier. These temporary hit points last 1 minute.

sheet.description: You can perform the somatic components of manifestations even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands. In addition, when you use your manifestation feature on your turn, you gain {{intelligence:modifier}} temporary hit points. These temporary hit points last 1 minute.

description.p: At 6th level, you command a strong presence on the battlefield. Non-allied creatures afflicted by a manifestation of yours have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than yourself. This effect only persists while the target is within 30 feet of you.

sheet.description: Non-allied creatures afflicted by a manifestation of yours have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than yourself. This effect only persists while the target is within 30 feet of you.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, when you use your action to create a manifestation, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

sheet.description: When you use your action to create a manifestation, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

description.p: When you reach 18th level, your spirit guide grants you the final part of his knowledge. When you use an action to conjure a manifestation that targets a creature, you can choose to conjure an additional manifestation of the same type on another creature within range, at no additional cost.

sheet.description: When you use an action to conjure a manifestation that targets a creature, you can choose to conjure an additional manifestation of the same type on another creature within range, at no additional cost.

description.p: The one that listens to those who skulks in the shadows follows the path of the Scoundrel. A trickster of sorts, the Scoundrel teaches their weavers how to use the shadows to their advantage and manipulate the battle from a hidden position. Weavers of this discipline embrace the darkness and their unnatural abilities, combining their abilities to strike fear where they go. The Scoundrel you follow may bean infamous assassin, or a highly regarded thief. Maybe your guide is a charlatan who seeks revenge through you.
Regardless, the Scoundrel spirit guide will hone your sneaking skills and your connection with the shadows.

Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to call upon an additional manifestation when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Expanded Manifestations table. The manifestation doesn’t count against the number of weavermanifestations you know.
When you choose this spirit guide at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in thieves’ tools, and your Proficiency Bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.

sheet.description: You double your Proficiency Bonus for any check made with your thieves’ tools.

description.p: At 3rd level, you learn to tactfully conjure manifestations. You do not need a verbal component when you create amanifestation. In addition, you can use the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: You do not need a verbal component when you create amanifestation. In addition, you can use the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, you do not provoke opportunity attacks from creatures under the influence of your manifestations.

sheet.description: You do not provoke opportunity attacks from creatures under the influence of your manifestations.

description.p: Upon reaching 10th level, you learn how to enter the spirit realm briefly. As an action on your turn, you become under the effects of the etherealness spell. This lasts for 1 minute, or until you end the effect as a bonus action.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long rest.

sheet.description: You become under the effects of the etherealness spell. This lasts for 1 minute, or until you end the effect as a bonus action.

description.p: When you reach 18th level, you learn to exploit weaknesses in your foes. If a creature is under the influence of at least one of your Manifestations, you gain the following benefits against them:

ul.li: You know the exact location of the target creature.
A creature has disadvantage on perception checks to hear, see, or smell you.
You can choose to make the target creature unaware it is affected by your manifestations, but the manifestations effect is suppressed while they are unaware of it.

You can choose to make the target creature unaware it is affected by your manifestations, but the manifestations effect is suppressed while they are unaware of it.
